thread.title: Love Island stars rally against “hypocrite” Jodie Marsh after she slates reality TV stars for having "sex on TV"
thread.title_full: Love Island stars rally against “hypocrite” Jodie Marsh after she slates reality TV stars for having "sex on TV"

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Love Island stars rally against “hypocrite” Jodie Marsh after she slates reality TV stars for having "sex on TV"
text:
Love Island stars rally against “hypocrite” Jodie Marsh after she slates reality TV stars for having "sex on TV" Former glamour model faces backlash from reality TV stars after comments she made about Chloe Ferry Share Reality stars vs Jodie Marsh Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Reality TV stars are rallying against “hypocrite” Jodie Marsh who slated Geordie Shore, Love Island and Ex On The Beach for not being “classy”. 
And now Love Island ’s Kady McDermott and CBB’s Casey Batchelor have weighed in on the feud. Kady McDermott had this to say about Jodie Marsh's comments (Photo: Twitter) 
Kady McDermott tweeted: “I completely understand why people get offended with sex on TV, but on Love Island you never actually saw it. 
“But when Jodie Marsh preaches about ‘class’ that’s when I have to step in. 
“Biggest hypocrite on the earth. Good night lovelies.” Casey Batchelor accused Jodie Marsh of being "jealous" (Photo: Twitter) 
Casey Batchelor shared a quote that read: “Shout out to the females that compliment each other. That jealousy s**t is dead.” 
Meanwhile, Jodie Marsh retweeted fans that sided with “#teamjodie”. 
She tweeted: “Unfortunately I can’t entertain the kids anymore. I have grown up things to do. But this has been fun tonight Twitter.” Reality stars vs Jodie Marsh (Photo: Twitter) 
Geordie Shore's Scott ' Scotty T ' Timlin – who has also appeared on Ex On The Beach – also joined in. 
Alongside a series of pictures of Jodie, he wrote: "Proper legend.... H Ps what's going on with your toes in the last pic (sic)" 
Jodie then retweeted a fan that called Scotty T ’s remarks “uncalled for”. Olivia Buckland was one of the first to weigh in (Photo: Copyright unknown) 
Then added: “I really am off now. My Kindle awaits. As always Twitter you are a massive source of amusement.” 
Earlier on, Olivia Buckland, who appeared on Love Island , quoted one of Jodie's tweet, adding: "LOL. is someone bitter?" 
She added: "Sitting on your high horse when you have no right to do so. How can you tweet about equality straight after slating others for life choices? Olivia Buckland slated Jodie Marsh for being "judgemental" (Photo: jodiemarshtv/instagram) 
"If u choose equality for race & gender u chose it for sexuality, you chose it for people having freedom to be themselves and not be judged." 
She later added that Jodie had blocked both her and her fiancé Alex Bowen. 
She wrote: "Ok so me and @ab_bowen07 have just been blocked. @LoveIsland is our baby and I will stick up for it forever. Hey it found me my fiancé! 
"Not only is @ LoveIsland my Bae. I [heart] reality TV. I love REALNESS. I love raw personalities. I hate judgemental people. Respect the hustle xx" Like us on Facebook
